database_id.description: The ID of the Astra database.

block.description: List of address requests that should have access to database endpoints.
`astra_access_list` resource represents a database access list, used to limit the ip's / CIDR groups that have access to a database.

cloud_provider.description: The cloud provider to launch the database.

region.description: Cloud region to launch the database.

block.description: `astra_database` provides an Astra Serverless Database resource. You can create and delete databases. Note: Classic Tier databases are not supported by the Terraform provider.

database_id.description: Astra database to create the keyspace.

name.description: Keyspace name can have up to 48 alpha-numeric characters and contain underscores; only letters and numbers are supported as the first character.

block.description: `astra_keyspace` provides a keyspace resource. Keyspaces are groupings of tables for Cassandra. `astra_keyspace` resources are associated with a database id. You can have multiple keyspaces per DB in addition to the default keyspace provided in the `astra_database` resource.

allowed_principals.description: List of service principals to apply to the Private Link (i.e. arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/admin).

database_id.description: Astra database where private link will be enabled.

datacenter_id.description: Astra datacenter in the region where the private link will be created.

service_name.description: Name of the endpoint service for private link generated by the cloud provider.

block.description: `astra_private_link` provides a private link resource. Private Link is a private network endpoint that can be created to connect from your vpc to Astra without using a pulically routable IP address. `astra_private_link` resources are associated with a database id. Currently GCP databases are not supported for private link. Once the private_link resource is created in Astra it must be linked to an endpoint within your vpc, use `astra_private_link_endpoint` to do this.

database_id.description: The ID of the Astra database.

datacenter_id.description: Astra datacenter in the region where the private link will be created.

endpoint_id.description: Endpoint created in your cloud provider account example: "vpce-svc-1148ea04af8675309"

block.description: `astra_private_link_endpoint` completes the creation of a private link endpoint by associating it with your endpoint.

policy.description: List of policies for the role.

resources.description: Resources for which role is applicable

block.description: `astra_role` resource represents custom roles for a particular Astra Org. Custom roles can be assigned to an Astra user is to grant them granular permissions when the default roles in the UI are not specific enough. Roles are composed of policies which are granted to resources.

client_id.description: Client id, use as username in cql to connect

secret.description: Secret, use as password in cql to connect

token.description: Token, use as auth bearer for API calls or as password in combination with the word `token` in cql

block.description: `astra_token` resource represents a token with a specific role assigned.

database_id.description: The ID of the Astra database.

results.description: The list of private links that match the search criteria.

block.description: `astra_access_list` provides a datasource that lists the access lists for an Astra database.

results.description: The list of supported Astra regions by cloud provider and tier.

block.description: Retrieve a list of available cloud regions in Astra

grafana_url.description: URL for the grafana dashboard for this database

node_count.description: Node count (not relevant for serverless databases)

region.description: Cloud provider region. Get list of supported regions from regions data-source

replication_factor.description: Replication Factor (not relevant for serverless databases)

total_storage.description: Storage Capacity (not relevant for serverelss databases)

block.description: `astra_database` provides a datasource for Astra an Astra database. This can be used to select an existing database within your Astra Organization.

results.description: The list of Astra databases that match the search criteria.

status.description: The list of Astra databases that match the search criteria.

block.description: `astra_databases` provides a datasource for a list of Astra databases. This can be used to select databases within your Astra Organization.

database_id.description: The ID of the Astra database.

block.description: `astra_keyspace` provides a datasource for a particular keyspace. See `astra_keyspaces` if you're looking to fetch all the keyspaces for a particular database.

database_id.description: The ID of the Astra database.

results.description: The list of keyspaces that match the search criteria.

block.description: `astra_keyspaces` provides a datasource that lists the keyspaces in an Astra database.

database_id.description: The ID of the Astra database.

datacenter_id.description: The Datacenter ID of the Astra database.

results.description: The list of private links that match the search criteria.

block.description: `astra_private_link_endpoints` provides a datasource that lists the private link endpoints for an Astra database.

database_id.description: The ID of the Astra database.

datacenter_id.description: The datacenter where of the Astra database.

results.description: The list of private links that match the search criteria.

block.description: `astra_private_links` provides a datasource that lists the private links in an Astra database.

results.description: The list of private links that match the search criteria.

block.description: `astra_role` provides a datasource that lists the custom roles for an org.

database_id.description: The ID of the Astra database.

url.description: The temporary download url to the secure connect bundle zip file.

block.description: `astra_secure_connect_bundle_url` provides a datasource that generates a temporary secure connect bundle URL. This URL lasts five minutes. Secure connect bundles are used to connect to Astra using cql cassandra drivers. See the [docs](https://docs.datastax.com/en/astra/docs/connecting-to-database.html) for more information on how to connect.
